chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher James Hintz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh. [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by DOC. Requesting a copy of JOC. Fax'd on 6/14/2016. km
c: Def, Atty, DA, Baldwin PD & Jail. eif
filed by ADA Sharon Correll. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Liddle ,ADA:   Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Christopher James Hintz appeared from jail. Case called at 2:42 p.m. Court states an amended information was filed. ADA Correll gives recommendations. There is a restitution claim of $3,631.07. Atty Caton states insufficient evidence at this time and the amount of restitution under dispute.   Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for amended count one Operate a Motor Vehicle Without Consent, Misd. , def pleads GUILTY. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of amended count 1. Restitution hearing to be scheduled. Court orders:

- 9 months jail concurrent to 07CF91 Sawyer CO, 07CF974 Brown CO  and  10CF339 Barron CO cases
- Costs $240 and DNA. Court suspends both costs.
Plea hearing on January 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Liddle. ,ADA:   Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Christopher James Hintz appeared from jail. Case called at 10:36 a.m. Atty Caton believes there is a resolution. ADA Correll states that Victim was contacted by Victim Witness Coordinator yesterday and victim does not wish to appear. ADA Correll will make sure Atty Caton has copies of the discovery. Bond continues. hml  Plea hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher James Hintz
Current: N2976 Westlane Road, Winter, WI 54896 United States  (Effective: 01-22-2015)
Prior: 418 Spruce Street, Baldwin, WI 54002 
per Defendant's bond. eif
Per EFV 1/22/15 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Status conference on January 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Megan M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EFV, RPT: Elizabeth Frank, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Christopher James Hintz appeared from jail.   Includes 14CF321 & (PayH) 14TR2250. Defendant does qualify for PD. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.   QUASH WARRANT. Defendant will be going to prison on 2/5/15 out of Baron County & Sawyer County.  On 14TR2250 to trail.  Status conference scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.
CO: EFV, RPT: Elizabeth Frank, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Matthew L. Hartung, NONA by def. State requests warrant due to non-appearance. Court issues warrant extraditable adj. states.
